_header: Of passed time the plaster of no care
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘Love’s Maledy’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 163) — three stanzas rhyme royal and four line Envoy (aabb)

BLHar682.First Lines:
OF passid tyme the plaster of no careVnto myn hert so long and soft
                    hath leyne…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Forwhi hit is so plesaunt a folyThe which is callid lovis
                    malady
